source: Minnesota Department of Veterans Affairs, Lutheran Social Service of Minnesota, NAMI Minnesota, VA Minneapolis Health Care

resources.name: Minneapolis VA Health Care System
resources.description: Center for excellence for Veteran-focused mental health care providing comprehensive medical care, mental health services, homeless veteran care, and community resource referrals

resources.name: Lutheran Social Service of Minnesota - Veterans Housing
resources.description: Provides supportive housing for veterans in Twin Cities metro area with rent subsidies and case management services addressing housing stability and individual needs

resources.name: LINKVET - Minnesota Veterans Resource
resources.description: Resource for Minnesota veterans providing referrals and information about available veteran services

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: NAMI Minnesota - Programs and Services for Veterans
resources.address: 1919 University Ave W, Suite 400, St. Paul, MN 55104
resources.description: National Alliance on Mental Illness provides mental health support, peer groups, and educational programs for veterans and military families

resources.name: Minnesota Department of Veteran Affairs
resources.description: State agency providing benefits, resources, and referrals for Minnesota veterans

resources.name: Minnesota Veterans One Stop
resources.description: Comprehensive veteran resources and information portal

resources.name: Military Self-Assessment Helpline
resources.description: 24/7 toll-free line with counselor transfer available for those experiencing post-traumatic stress

resources.name: County Veterans Service Officer (CVSO)
resources.description: Local county offices providing veterans services, benefits assistance, and resource referrals. Every county in Minnesota has a CVSO.

resources.name: Transitional Residence Program
resources.description: Rehabilitation-focused residential program for veterans recovering from mental illness, drug or alcohol dependency, and homelessness

resources.name: Hire Heroes USA
resources.description: Employment assistance and job placement services for veterans overcoming employment barriers

resources.name: Wounded Warrior Project
resources.description: Support and services for post-9/11 veterans and service members with physical or mental injuries

resources.name: U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
resources.description: Nationwide services and resources for veterans and families including healthcare, benefits, homeless services, and women veterans programs

additional_resources.real_warriors: https://www.realwarriors.net/ - Mental health and resilience resources
additional_resources.homeless_veteran_hotline: 1-877-424-3838 - National Call Center for Homeless Veterans

notes: This directory includes major state and federal veteran resources in Minnesota. Contact your local County Veterans Service Officer (CVSO) for county-specific services. Many services are free and confidential.
